title: Charity 5K: Conclusions from a Boxplot
question_text:
Recently, a community group held a 5K Race/Fun Walk to raise money for local charities. The event was advertised as being appropriate for all ages and ability levels. Sure enough, on race day, entrants ranged from the most competitive fitness enthusiasts who ran the race at their top speed, to grandparents walking the course at a leisurely pace with their young grandchildren.
The distribution of the amount of time it took participants to finish the course are displayed in the boxplot below.

Which of the following statements correctly describes the shape of the distribution and the relative positioning of the mean and median race times?

choices.text: The distribution is roughly symmetric and the mean race time equals the median race time.
The distribution is skewed left and the mean race time is less than the median race time.
The distribution is skewed left and the mean race time is greater than the median race time.
The distribution is skewed right and the mean race time is less than the median race time.
The distribution is skewed right and the mean race time is greater than the median race time.

From the boxplot, we know the median of this distribution is about

Explanation of Distractors

Choice 'A' is incorrect. While the mean will equal the median in a symmetric distribution, this distribution is not roughly symmetric.

Choices 'B' and 'C' are incorrect. In a distribution that is skewed to the left, the mean will be less than the median. However, this distribution is not skewed to the left.

Choice 'D' is incorrect. In a distribution that is skewed to the right, the mean will be greater than the median.
